name:
Fund for incentives to attract investment, job creation, strategic
 sectors, and large-scale economic diversification
description: State-level enabling law establishing a comprehensive framework to attract investment, support industrial/ productive projects, define “strategic enterprises”, grant incentives for investment, employment, industrial units, and promote industrial parks / microparks / industrial cities within the state.
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento a la Inversión y al Empleo del Estado de Aguascalientes
notes: Law creates enabling framework; actual projects/beneficiaries to be coded when firms apply and locate in state under its provisions; includes criteria for “strategic enterprises”, support for industrial units and incentives depending on employment, investment, innovation, environment.
sources: Congreso del Estado de Aguascalientes. "Ley de Incentivos para Atraer Inversión, Crear Empleos, Fortalecer Sectores Estratégicos y Diversificar Económicamente." Periódico Oficial del Estado, 2025. https://congresoags.gob.mx/agenda_legislativa/descargar_pdf/996. [Location: Ley vigente]

name: HubsPark Tech Campus
description: New industrial-tech campus “HubsPark Tech Campus” launched by MEOR in July 2025: 167 hectares in five phases, intended to host advanced manufacturing, electronics, medical devices, logistics, tech firms; first phase under construction (120,000 m²) — total planned investment US$800 million, projected 6,000 direct + 10,000 indirect jobs.
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico para el Estado de Baja California
partners: Gobierno de Baja California; private sector
notes: Industrial park was announced, construction expected to last 7 years; jobs: 6,000 (direct) + 10,000 (indirect)
sources: Mexico Industry. "Meor Apuesta por un Nuevo Ecosistema Industrial, Tecnológico y Financiero en Tijuana con Inversión de 800 MDD." Mexico Industry, 2025. https://mexicoindustry.com/noticia/meor-apuesta-por-un-nuevo-ecosistema-industrial-tecnologico-y-financiero-en-tijuana-con-inversion-de-800-mdd. [Location: Project announcement; phases 1-7; employment generation]

name: Industrial Gate Pacific
description: New industrial park in Tijuana: ~278,700 m² (3 million ft²) of warehouses, with DHL Supply Chain as the first tenant and a focus on logistics, manufacturing, automotive, e-commerce, and logistics services.
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico para el Estado de Baja California
partners: Gobierno de Baja California; private sector
notes: Role of government to be confirmed.
sources: Cluster Industrial de México. "Inicia la Construcción de Industrial Gate Pacific con una Inversión de 205 MDD." Cluster Industrial, 2023. https://clusterindustrial.com.mx/inicia-la-construccion-de-industrial-gate-pacific-con-una-inversion-de-205-mdd/. [Location: Project announcement; 5-year development; 60 hectares]

name: Puerto Punta Colonet
description: Puerto Punta Colonet - multimodal port development project with 50-year federal concession granted to state entity, construction programmed 2026-2035 in three phases covering 2,769 hectares
legal_basis: Ley de Puertos; Ley de Fomento Económico para el Estado de Baja California
partners: Gobierno de Baja California; private sector
notes: Terminal capacity 17.5m draft; NeoPanamax vessels; Phase 1 (2027): 1.2M TEUs, 2 berths; Phase 3: 4.8M TEUs, 8 berths; 4,500 direct + 30,000 indirect jobs during construction; private financing. Controversies exist regarding the ecological impact of the project; local citizens have stated how they were not considered in the preparation of the environmental impact manifesto, even though authorities claim that the project is sustainable; jobs: 4500 (direct) + 30,000 (indirect)
sources: La Jornada. "Gobierno de Baja California Obtiene Concesión para Mega Puerto de Punta Colonet." La Jornada, September 6, 2025. https://www.jornada.com.mx/noticia/2025/09/06/estados/gobierno-de-baja-california-obtiene-concesion-para-mega-puerto-de-punta-colonet. [Location: Port concession announcement; 2,769 hectares; 50-year concession]

name: Talento BC
description: Talento BC - state initiative connecting companies and universities through 18 sectoral working groups (mesas) focused on electronics, semiconductors, and advanced manufacturing workforce development
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico para el Estado de Baja California
partners: Gobierno de Baja California; private sector
notes: 105 teachers graduated in semiconductor specialization program (2024-2025) in partnership with University of Arizona; 18 sectoral mesas including semiconductors, electromobility
sources: Uniradio Informa Baja California. "Resalta Gobernadora Marina Pilar Potencial BC para Liderar Cadena de Suministro de Semiconductores en Norteamérica." Uniradio Informa, 2022. https://www.uniradiobaja.com/gobierno/resalta-gobernadora-marina-pilar-potencial-bc-liderar-cadena-suministro-semiconductores-norteamerica-n802944. [Location: Governor speech on semiconductor training initiative]

name: Zona Alfa
description: industrial-park development near Tijuana, designed as an “ecosystem”: combining industrial space, logistics, sustainability, housing/training for talent, and integrated infrastructure,  to attract nearshoring-oriented foreign investors.
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico para el Estado de Baja California
partners: Gobierno de Baja California; private sector
notes: Located just 10 minutes from the U.S. commercial border crossing, Zona Alfa is strategically positioned to attract foreign investment, especially from Asian manufacturers seeking relocation options in North America due to rising U.S. tariffs. Need to verify public incentives or state support to classify as “policy
sources: Mexico Industry. "Turnkey Projects Desarrolla en Tijuana uno de los Parques Industriales más Innovadores del País." Mexico Industry, 2025. https://mexicoindustry.com/noticia/turnkey-projects-desarrolla-en-tijuana-uno-de-los-parques-industriales-mas-innovadores-del-pais. [Location: Park features; 340 hectares; workforce development focus]

name: Aura Solar III - La Paz
description: Advanced solar project (32 MWp) with lithium-ion battery storage (10.5 MW, 7.0 MWh capacity) operating since 2018. First large-scale storage solution in Latin America enabling round-the-clock power supply from renewable source.
legal_basis: Power purchase agreement with CFE
notes: US$45 million investment. Represents technological advancement with integrated battery storage solution using string-type solar inverters. Commercial operation since 2018.
sources: PV Magazine México. "Elmya construye la primera planta solar con almacenamiento a gran escala en mexico." 02 de mayo de 2019. https://www.pv-magazine-mexico.com/2019/05/02/elmya-construye-la-primera-planta-solar-con-almacenamiento-a-gran-escala-en-mexico.

name: Federal Solar-Thermal Plants Investment Program
description: Federal government announcement (August 2025) for 800 million pesos (US$42.8 million) investment to construct two 50-megawatt solar-thermal power plants with thermal storage in Baja California Sur. Planned to benefit 100,000-200,000 households. CFE studying installation sites.
legal_basis: Federal energy infrastructure decree 2025-2030
notes: Two solar-thermal plants 50 MW each, first stage. Part of national electrical system strengthening and expansion 2025-2030. Addresses BCS electricity generation costs (highest in country at US$110/MWh vs national US$30/MWh average).
sources: "Anuncia gobierno federal construccion de planta termosolar con dos centrales en baja california sur." Accessed February 2026. https://voxpopulinoticias.com.mx/2025/08/anuncia-gobierno-federal-construccion-de-planta-termosolar-con-dos-centrales-en-baja-california-sur. [Nota: Monto de inversión pública citado en el artículo.]

name: International Investment in Clean Energy (New Fortress Energy, Eurus, Invenergy)
description: Combined US investment generating 220 MW clean energy from multiple companies (New Fortress Energy, Eurus America, Invenergy). Contributes one-third of state's electricity generation, improving energy security and reducing fossil fuel dependence.
legal_basis: Power purchase agreements with CFE
partners: US companies (New Fortress Energy, Eurus America, Invenergy)
notes: 220 MW renewable capacity represents technology transfer and bilateral clean energy cooperation. Addresses high electricity costs in BCS.
sources: "Inversiones estadounidenses en baja california sur brindan un impulso sin precedentes a las energias limpias." Accessed February 2026. https://mx.usembassy.gov/es/inversiones-estadounidenses-en-baja-california-sur-brindan-un-impulso-sin-precedentes-a-las-energias-limpias.

name: Los Cabos Airport Solar Farm Development
description: Grupo Aeroportuario del Pacífico (GAP) developing large-scale solar farm for Los Cabos International Airport to achieve energy self-sufficiency. Project in advanced development stage with more than one year of planning.
legal_basis: Airport development authorization
agency: Grupo Aeroportuario del Pacífico (GAP), Secretaría de Aviación
notes: Major project for airport energy independence. Strategic for tourism development and sustainability. BCS has 5 peak solar hours annually.
sources: "Los cabos airport eyes energy independence with solar project." Accessed February 2026. https://gringogazette.com/2025/08/07/los-cabos-airport-eyes-energy-independence-with-solar-project.; [Infrastructure Project Portal - Proyectos México]. "302 aeropuerto de los cabos." Accessed February 2026. https://www.proyectosmexico.gob.mx/proyecto_inversion/302-aeropuerto-de-los-cabos/. [Nota: Ficha técnica del proyecto.]

name: Luis Echeverría Solar PV Project - Mulegé
description: Solar photovoltaic plant with battery backup built in 2016 in Luis Echeverría ejido, Mulegé municipality. 342 kW capacity using 468 photovoltaic panels with battery storage. Total investment of 27 million pesos.
legal_basis: Federal renewable energy program
notes: Small-scale project supporting rural electrification. 27 million peso investment for 342 kW capacity.
sources: "Los combustibles fosiles y la infraestructura aislada sofocan la adopcion de energias renovables en baja california sure." Accessed February 2026. https://yaleclimateconnections.org/2024/07/los-combustibles-fosiles-y-la-infraestructura-aislada-sofocan-la-adopcion-de-energias-renovables-en-baja-california-sure. [Nota: Monto de inversión pública citado en el artículo.]

name: Technical Training in Fishing and Tourism (Centro de Estudios Tecnológicos del Mar)
description: Technical education program training professionals in sports fishing, diving and recreational aquatic tourism. Técnico en Pesca Deportiva y Buceo prepares workers for tourism, sports fishing and recreational diving enterprises across BCS maritime zones.
legal_basis: SEP authorization
agency: Centro de Estudios Tecnológicos del Mar 31, Secretaría de Educación
partners: Tourism operators, diving schools, fishing companies
notes: Cabo San Lucas is 'World Marlin Capital'. Program supports sports fishing (La Paz, Los Cabos, Loreto) and recreational diving as tourism activities.
sources: "Baja california." Accessed February 2026. https://www.educaweb.mx/centros/explotaciones-agroalimentarias-jardineria-mineria/pesca-acuicultura/baja-california/.; [State Secretariat - SETUES (Tourism & Economics)]. "Icatebcs." Accessed February 2026. https://setuesbcs.gob.mx/icatebcs/.

name: Tourism and Wellness Program
description: Strategic promotion of wellness tourism in Los Cabos combining world-class spas and accessible wellness experiences. Wellness tourism generates US$651 billion globally with 16.6% annual growth projected through 2027.
legal_basis: Tourism development strategy
agency: SETUE Baja California Sur, Tourism Board
partners: Private hospitality sector, spas, wellness providers
notes: Los Cabos attracts high-value wellness tourists (US$3,000+ per visitor). Global Wellness Institute data shows 651 billion USD annual wellness tourism market.
sources: "Turismo wellness o de bienestar genera para los cabos hasta 3 mil dolares por visitante." Accessed February 2026. https://www.diarioelindependiente.mx/2025/06/turismo-wellness-o-de-bienestar-genera-para-los-cabos-hasta-3-mil-dolares-por-visitante.; [State Secretariat - SETUES]. "Documento." Accessed February 2026. https://setuesbcs.gob.mx/.

name: Decreto de Estímulos Fiscales en los Polos de Desarrollo Económico para el Bienestar
description: Federal decree (published May 22, 2025) granting tax incentives to companies and developers operating in Development Poles, including 100% deduction of investment in fixed assets and 25% additional deduction for worker training expenses through 2030.
legal_basis: Decreto DOF 22/05/2025
agency: Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público
partners: Comité Intersecretarial de Promoción de Polos
notes: Applies to Seybaplaya Polo de Bienestar and other 14 approved development poles nationwide
sources: Diario Oficial de la Federación. "Nota detalle." 22 de mayo de 2025. https://www.dof.gob.mx/nota_detalle.php?codigo=5758077&fecha=22/05/2025.; Diario Oficial de la Federación. "Nota detalle." 22 de mayo de 2025. https://dof.gob.mx/nota_detalle.php?codigo=5758077&fecha=22/05/2025. [Nota: Texto completo del decreto.]

name: Fisheries Support Program (SEPESCA)
description: Federal and state government initiative providing incentives for fishing and aquaculture activities. Supports infrastructure works, rural aquaculture development, vessel modernization, energy inputs, and training in equipment maintenance.
legal_basis: Federal program SAGARPA-CONAPESCA, Ley de Pesca y Acuacultura Sustentables
notes: Invested 74.6 million pesos for fishing/aquaculture productivity. 81 rural aquaculture projects generating 588 tons of production (tilapia). Sonda de Campeche reopened for fishing after 30 years with support for 215 PEMEX platform workers.
sources: Gobierno de México. "Sector pesquero de campeche se fortalece con incentivos." Accessed February 2026. https://www.gob.mx/agricultura/campeche/articulos/sector-pesquero-de-campeche-se-fortalece-con-incentivos.; [Federal Agency - CONAPESCA]. "Sitios de pesca campeche." Accessed February 2026. https://conapesca.gob.mx/wb/cona/sitios_de_pesca_campeche. [Nota: Monto de inversión pública citado en el artículo. Cifra de empleos citada en el artículo.]

name: Polo de Desarrollo Económico para el Bienestar Seybaplaya I
description: Strategic development pole in Seybaplaya covering territorial area with infrastructure and targeted tax benefits to promote economic activity. Focus sectors include logistics, agribusiness, energy manufacturing, tourism, fishing, livestock, oil, gas, solar energy and circular economy.
legal_basis: Plan México, PODECOBI Declaration
partners: Presidencia de la República, Comité Intersecretarial
notes: Located 4.9 km from Seybaplaya Port, 29 km from Campeche Port, 36 km from international airport, 37 km from Maya Train. Strategic connectivity on Federal Highway 180. Part of 15 PODECOBIs nationwide targeting 300,000 jobs and 1.5 trillion pesos investment.
sources: Gobierno de México. "1001 podecobi seybaplaya i campeche." Accessed February 2026. https://www.proyectosmexico.gob.mx/proyecto_inversion/1001-podecobi-seybaplaya-i-campeche/. [Nota: Ficha técnica del proyecto. Cifra de empleos citada en el artículo.]

name: SEDECO Economic Reactivation and Employment Support Programs
description: State government programs delivering equipment and financing to over 450 MiPyMEs in Campeche for 2025. Covers up to 70% of solar panel installation costs and provides financing at 85% for product transformation including labeling, lab analysis and standards compliance.
legal_basis: SEDECO Campeche authorization
partners: Governor Layda Elena Sansores San Román administration
notes: Benefiting 450+ MiPyMEs with equipment delivery and financing. Solar component promotes renewable energy adoption.
sources: Gobierno de México. "Mipymes." Accessed February 2026. https://sedeco.campeche.gob.mx/category/mipymes/. [Nota: Monto de inversión pública citado en el artículo. Cifra de empleos citada en el artículo.]

name: ADITECH Technical Commission for Scientists and Technologists
description: Agencia Digital Tecnológica established Technical Commission for formation of scientists and technologists with representatives from Chiapas academic and productive sectors. Aims to consolidate scientific and technological community contributing to economic development.
legal_basis: ADITECH authorization
agency: ADITECH, Secretaría de Economía y del Trabajo
notes: Links academic sector with productive sector promoting innovation for economic development.
sources: Gobierno de México. "Aditech instala comision tecnica formacion cientificos tecnologos chiapas." Accessed February 2026. https://aditech.chiapas.gob.mx/nota/aditech-instala-comision-tecnica-formacion-cientificos-tecnologos-chiapas.

name: Corredor Interoceánico del Istmo de Tehuantepec (CIIT)
description: Major infrastructure project connecting Pacific and Atlantic oceans through rail transport via Isthmus of Tehuantepec Railway. Integrates four major ports (Coatzacoalcos, Salina Cruz, Dos Bocas, Puerto Chiapas) with ~1,200 km rail platform. Federal investment of 700 million pesos in Puerto Chiapas infrastructure.
legal_basis: Federal megaproject decree (AMLO administration 2015, continued Sheinbaum)
partners: Puerto Chiapas, rail operators, port authorities
notes: 77.3% progress on railway works as of 2024. Expected completion H1 2026. Creates multimodal logistics alternative to Suez Canal. Two industrial parks planned in Chiapas.
sources: Gobierno de México. "Interoceanic corridor of the isthmus of tehuantepec." Accessed February 2026. https://www.proyectosmexico.gob.mx/en/interoceanic-corridor-of-the-isthmus-of-tehuantepec/.; [Federal Decree - CIIT Portal]. "Decreto de creacion del corredor interoceanico del istmo de tehuantepec." Accessed February 2026. https://www.gob.mx/ciit/documentos/decreto-de-creacion-del-corredor-interoceanico-del-istmo-de-tehuantepec.; Diario Oficial de la Federación. "Nota detalle." 29 de septiembre de 2017. https://dof.gob.mx/nota_detalle.php?codigo=5499448&fecha=29/09/2017. [Nota: Texto completo del decreto. Monto de inversión pública citado en el artículo. Página institucional del clúster/asociación.]

name: ICATECH Workforce Training and Certification Program
description: Instituto de Capacitación y Vinculación Tecnológica del Estado de Chiapas offers over 600 training courses across 12 training areas (32 courses) in 104 educational centers in 37 municipalities. Delivers 1,902 officially valid training certificates through strategic projects, achieving national record.
legal_basis: Decreto de Creación de ICATECH
notes: National benchmark for workforce development. Programs in 37 municipalities strengthen labor market alignment with economic development.
sources: Gobierno de México. "Documento." Accessed February 2026. https://icatech.gob.mx/.; [State Training Institute - ICATECH]. "Documento." Accessed February 2026. https://www.icatech.gob.mx/.

name: Polo de Desarrollo para el Bienestar Tapachula I
description: Development Pole covering 263 hectares strategically located on Puerto Madero Highway in Tapachula municipality. Located 5.22 km from Puerto de Chiapas and 5.98 km from Tapachula International Airport. Aims to promote agro-industrial investments and generate jobs through multimodal logistics platform.
legal_basis: Declaratoria Federal, DOF
agency: Secretaría de Economía y del Trabajo Chiapas, Secretaría de Bienestar
partners: Comité Intersecretarial de Promoción de Polos, Puerto de Chiapas
notes: Declared officially April 8, 2025. Part of Plan México strategy to transform Tapachula into 'industrial capital' of Central America. Integrated with national rail and port system.
sources: Gobierno de México. "5754325." Accessed February 2026. https://sidof.segob.gob.mx/notas/docFuente/5754325.

name: Polo de Desarrollo para el Bienestar Tapachula II
description: Second development pole covering 149 hectares located on Puerto Madero Highway with access to Zone Naval road in Tapachula municipality. Complements Tapachula I in creating integrated logistics and agro-industrial zone.
legal_basis: Declaratoria Federal, DOF
agency: Secretaría de Economía y del Trabajo Chiapas, Secretaría de Bienestar
partners: Comité Intersecretarial de Promoción de Polos
notes: Declared officially April 8, 2025. Two Tapachula poles cover 512 hectares combined, strengthening regional industrial capacity for cross-border trade with Guatemala.
sources: "Gobierno declara los polos de desarrollo tapachula i y ii en chiapas." Accessed February 2026. https://calatravaconsultores.com.mx/2025/04/08/gobierno-declara-los-polos-de-desarrollo-tapachula-i-y-ii-en-chiapas.

name: Producción para el Bienestar - Coffee and Cacao Program
description: Federal welfare program supporting agricultural producers of grains, sugarcane, coffee, cacao, nopal and honey. Minimum support 6,000 pesos, maximum 24,000 pesos per beneficiary for 2025. Over 141.7 million pesos allocated in prior two years with free fertilizer distribution.
legal_basis: Federal welfare program decree
notes: Chiapas ranks #1 nationally in coffee production (2024) and #2 in cacao. Program supports sustainable production increases.
sources: Gobierno de México. "Produccion para el bienestar." Accessed February 2026. https://programasparaelbienestar.gob.mx/produccion-para-el-bienestar/. [Nota: Monto de inversión pública citado en el artículo.]

name: Puerto Chiapas Special Economic Zone (SEZ)
description: 8,216-hectare SEZ established September 2017 in Chiapas-Guatemala border region. Offers 100% income tax discount for 10 years, 50% for next 5 years; VAT exemption on goods/services; 50% social security discount for 10 years, 25% for next 5 years.
legal_basis: Federal SEZ Decree (Peña Nieto 2015), continued under subsequent administrations
agency: Secretaría de Economía, PRODECHI, Puerto Chiapas Authority
notes: Mandated to spur agribusiness investments in traditional agricultural region. Target: 8,000 new jobs. Tax incentives available through 2027.
sources: "Puerto chiapas sez." Accessed February 2026. https://developmentseed.org/sez-docs/results/puerto-chiapas-sez/. [Nota: Cifra de empleos citada en el artículo.]

name: Aerocluster Chihuahua
description: Triple Helix aerospace cluster coordination. Mission to be a pillar sector in the region’s economic development. Due to Chihuahua’s physical, economic, and financial infrastructure that influences the public policies and private sector, to achieve leadership and world-class competitiveness.
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico del Estado de Chihuahua; Acuerdo de creación del clúster
notes: Annual sales ~USD 1.5B; 2024 FDI USD 130M; 1/3 of MX aerospace workforce
sources: Cluster Aeroespacial de Chihuahua. "Cluster Aeroespacial." Accessed February 2026. https://english.aeroclusterchihuahua.com/. [Location: Cluster members; 46+ certified suppliers; aerospace employment data]

name: Estímulos Fiscales a ISN
description: ISN has been in fluctuation year-to-year since 2022, currently stands at 4% for 2026. However annual ISN reduction to taxpayers, considering: their number of employees, strategic investments, their support to their workers in obtaining basic education certification, hiring vulnerable populations
legal_basis: Ley de Hacienda del Estado de Chihuahua; Ley de Fomento Económico del Estado de Chihuahua
agency: SIDE (Secretaría de Innovación y Desarrollo Económico)
sources: Gobierno de México. "Estímulos Fiscales a ISN: Decree 57/2010." Portal Gubernamental del Estado de Chihuahua, 2012. https://tramites.chihuahua.gob.mx/tramite.aspx?identificador=2136. [Location: Tax incentive administration; payroll tax reductions]

name: Fondo Estatal de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación (FECTI)
description: Competitive grants for science, technology, and innovation
legal_basis: Ley de Ciencia y Tecnología del Estado de Chihuahua
agency: SIDE (Secretaría de Innovación y Desarrollo Económico)
notes: * 2024: 80M MXN Fund divided between five tracks: Talent Development in Science, Technology and Innovation; Infrastructure, Science and Technology; Frontier Science; Innovation and Entrepreneurship; and Venture Capital Fund
sources: Gobierno de México. "Continúan Abiertas las Convocatorias del Fondo Estatal de Ciencia, Tecnología e Innovación." Portal Gubernamental del Estado de Chihuahua, 2023. https://chihuahua.gob.mx/prensa/continuan-abiertas-las-convocatorias-del-fondo-estatal-de-ciencia-tecnologia-e-innovacion. [Location: FECTI launch December 11, 2023; 80 million pesos]

name: Green Generation MX
description: Collaboration between local education institutions and the International Youth Foundation (IYF), aiming to  implement the Green Generation MX program in the state, through which electromobility training scholarships were be awarded to Mechanical Engineering teachers.
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico del Estado de Chihuahua
agency: SIDE (Secretaría de Innovación y Desarrollo Económico)
notes: 100+ teachers certified across 4 editions and several educational institutions.
sources: International Youth Foundation. "Green Skills: Green Generation MX." Accessed February 2026. https://iyfglobal.org/initiative/green-skills/. [Location: Education initiative; 11 Mexican states; EV manufacturing, data science]

name:
Instituto de Capacitación para el Trabajo del 
Estado de Chihuahua (ICATECH)
description: ICATECH vocational training network
legal_basis: Ley de Educación del Estado de Chihuahua
agency: ICATECH (Instituto de Capacitación para el Trabajo de Chihuahua)
notes: 22 centers; low-cost/free courses; 31,675 courses; 1,529 instructors.
sources: Instituto de Capacitación para el Trabajo del Estado de Chihuahua. "ICATECH: Institutional Overview." Accessed February 2026. https://www.icatech.edu.mx/. [Location: Institution founding 2000; workforce training]

name: Modelo Mexicano de Formación Dual (MMFD)
description: Mexican Model for Dual Formation aims to strengthen the academic and technical training of the young people of Chihuahua, this by connecting education and productive reality
legal_basis: Acuerdo CONALEP-CANACINTRA para Formación Dual; Ley Federal del Trabajo
agency: SIDE Chihuahua / Cámara de la Industria de Transformación (CANACINTRA)
notes: Stipends, uniforms, meals, transport provided by firms. COPARMEX and Colegio de Estudios Científicos y Tecnológicos del Estado de Chihuahua  (CECyTECH) formalized a collaboration agreement that will consolidate MMFD in the campuses of the subsystem, as well as expand the opportunities for linking with the productive sector of the state
sources: Secretaría de Educación Pública. "Modelo Mexicano de Formación Dual (MMFD)." Subsecretaría de Educación Media Superior, 2013-2025. https://educacionmediasuperior.sep.gob.mx/es_mx/sems/modelo_mexicano_de_formacion_dual_mmfd. [Location: Dual education model; CONALEP Chihuahua pilot 2013; 218 graduates as of 2025]

name: Mujeres in Tech
description:
Mujeres in Tech: trainings for women in tech, with scholarships 
for online courses on techinical and digital skills
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico del Estado de Chihuahua
notes: 100% scholarships; web dev, design tools, SolidWorks. 124 enrolled students, ages 17+.
sources: CENALTEC y Fondo Unido Chihuahua. "Mujeres in Tech: Programa de Capacitación Tecnológica." CENALTEC, 2023. https://chihuahua.gob.mx/prensa/lanzan-cenaltec-y-fondo-unido-chihuahua-convocatoria-para-capacitar-mujeres-en-el-sector. [Location: Women tech training; Web, Design, CAD; 100% scholarship]

name:
Plan Emergente de Apoyo y Protección a la Salud,
Empleo e Ingreso Familiar
description: COVID-19 emergency ISN relief (exemption/reduction/deferral)
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico del Estado de Chihuahua
agency: SIDE (Secretaría de Innovación y Desarrollo Económico)
notes: Businesses must maintain 70% workforce.
sources: Gobierno de México. "Plan Emergente de Apoyo y Protección a la Salud, Empleo e Ingreso Familiar." Portal Gubernamental del Estado de Chihuahua, 2020. https://chihuahua.gob.mx/contenidos/programa-emergente-de-estimulos-fiscales-beneficiara-41996-empresas-con-4343-mdp. [Location: COVID-19 emergency program; 3.2 billion pesos; April 2020 launch]

name: Programa Desafío
description: Youth soft skills/ competencies + technical training. Mission is to allow students from ages 16-29 to work on their professional development, through specialized and certified training
legal_basis: Ley de Fomento Económico del Estado de Chihuahua
agency: SIDE (Secretaría de Innovación y Desarrollo Económico)
notes:
